title: Hapootatah--Playgrounds
name: Hapootatah--Playgrounds
description:
A Map by Micropopetah

These are Micropopetah's local playgrounds and parks

properties.name: Albion Park Playground
properties.description: Posted by Micropopetah   Albion St and Lowell St, Somerville, MAfrom the City of Somerville Website:"Albion Playground is on Albion Street between Cedar and Lowell streets The municipal playground is handicapped accessible and contains play equipment, a basketball court, hopscotch, a four square and a street hockey court."Four Square! I am totally there!

properties.name: Cedar Street Park, aka Reverand Thomas J. Williams Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing     33 Dudley Street, Cambridge, MAThis is a really well-designed park. The little kids\' area is fenced and only has one exit, which has a nice table strategically situated right in front of it, where you can sit and work and stand guard at the same time. The larger park also has only one exit to watch, really. There is a back exit, but it\'s far away from the playground equipment and not very appealing to the kids. There\'s a good climbing structure, and water play in the summer. There are almost always kids here, even very early in the morning. Another great thing about this park is that dogs are allowed and tolerated off leash when the park isn\'t crowded. There are poop-pick-up bags in the park and an area where you can throw a ball or stick. Great park, great internet connection.

properties.name: Central Hill Playground
properties.description: Posted by Micropopetah  81 Highland Ave, Somerville, MACity of Somerville website:Central Hill Playground is in front of Somerville High School, at 81 Highland Ave, next to the Somerville Library. It contains separate play areas for young children (ages 1 to 4) and older children (5 to 10).

properties.name: Conway Park
properties.description: Posted by Micropopetahsomerville ave & Central St, Somerville, MAFrom the City of Somerville website:"Conway Park, on Somerville Avenue at Central Street, contains two basketball courts and two baseball fields, which double as soccer and football fields. The park is in the process of being renovated and expanded to also include parking, street hockey, and a tot lot. Conway Park is handicapped accessible."This park looks pretty impressive, but its proximity to busy, loud, and polluting Somerville Ave is a bit of a turn off.

properties.name: Corbett McKenna Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Prospect Hill Ave and Munroe St, Somerville, MAGreat view, new equipment. There aren\'t any tables, just benches.

properties.name: Corbett McKenna Park
properties.description: Posted by MicropopetahProspect Hill Ave and Munroe St, Somerville, MA

properties.name: Crummy Traffic Noise Playground
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Grove St and Highland St, Somerville, MAThis is a crummy park, not because of the equipment, which is in good shape and quite nice, but mainly because of the location. The noise of traffic is just loud enough to be annoying and relentless. There\'s usually a drunk person or two hanging out next to the disintegrating non-funtioning water fountain. It\'s more a place for teenagers to hang out and clandestinely smoke cigarettes and write cuss words on the swings than a place to hang out with your kids. Very spotty wifi.

properties.name: Danehy Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Super FunThis is a really great park, It\'s big, with a playground and hills and a field. There\'s even a sprinkler. Every summer they have a free festival with free kiddie carnival rides and free hot dogs. There\'s a little marsh, reminding us that Cambridge is really just a big filled-in swamp, underneath the swank. There\'s a wifi connection near the playground equipment, where there are also picnic tables. There\'s spotty wifi up in the field area. It\'s just someone\'s liksys, so it might not be on all the time. There\'s a tiny parking lot. Great place for a birthday party.

properties.name: Daycare Park
properties.description: Posted by Micropopetah   the daily local hang outThree different daycares congregate here every single weekday morning. It\'s a great place to hang out with your kid. Local people bring their old toys here and drop them off, so it is full of old plastic wagons, scooters, toy gas pumps, playhouses, annd one very large sdandbox tugboat. The park was also renovated this year. One of the coolest things about this park is that the flowering trees attract honey bees from a local hive. They\'re gentle honey bees. I\'ve never seen a kid gett stung, thought they run through the water puddle where the bees congregate to drink. Excellent climbing trees!

properties.name: East Somerville Playground
properties.description: Posted by Micropopetah  Pearl St and cross St, Somerville, MAFrom the City of Somerville Website"East Somerville Community Playground is Located on the corner of Pearl and Cross Streets, playground is handicapped accessible, contains play equipment for older children and a tot lot, two full basketball courts, two half basketball courts and a small arboretum."

properties.name: Holland Street Playground
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing     Holland and Pauline, Somerville, MAThere are lots of networks to choose from, but no picnic tables or tables of any kind, so the word laptop has to be taken literally. There\'s a nice play structure, a baseball field, plenty of shade, and a little kids\' area. Also, sand! It\'s dog-friendly and there\'s room for flying kites and playing frisbee.

properties.name: Playground on the Parkway
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   56 waterhouse st, somerville, MAThere is something weird about the way city planners put little kids\' playgrounds right next to highways in cities. I yell at my kid enough under normal circumstances, without having to do it just to be heard over the drone of traffic. This park does have a waterplay toy which sprays water down on you like a shower.

properties.name: Tufts Campus
properties.description: Posted by Micropopetahgreat hills for rolling downThis is a fun place to hang out on the grass. They have a big cannon with a gazillion layers of paint on it which you can climb on. It\'s at the top of the hill and there\'s a great view. Look for the elephants!

properties.name: Waldo Park
properties.description: Posted by Micropopetah   This is a pretty nice park, with a basketball court and everything. They just redid it with all new equipment. - -
